pages.text: Camuropiscis was a genus of arthrodire placoderm that lived during the Late Devonian (some 383 - 372 million years ago). Its fossils have been found at the famous Gogo Formation of Kimberly, Western Australia. Its name translates to "flat-nosed fish", and refers to its flattened, elongated snout, which may have been used for more streamlined swimming.
